body_html: @petewarden - I cherry picked your commit onto the branch we were working off of before (0d2f691) and it does indeed fix the problem where CPU usage is pegged in a never-ending Steal cycle. Success! The one caveat is that these threads appear to still exist, just in an inactive state. (See screenshot from Xcode below - there are four threads all sleeping in the same state.) Is that the intended behaviour?

body: @petewarden - I cherry picked your commit onto the branch we were working off of before (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/0d2f6918322c7bf29d1de3075b0d4ed3b1b72919) and it does indeed fix the problem where CPU usage is pegged in a never-ending `Steal` cycle. Success! The one caveat is that these threads appear to still exist, just in an inactive state. (See screenshot from Xcode below - there are four threads all sleeping in the same state.) Is that the intended behaviour?
